hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Volatility Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and experiences a 3-day consecutive decline in price with simultaneously rising 20-day realized volatility above its 60-day average by 1.5 standard deviations, a transition to BEAR regime occurs within the next 5 trading days with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often break via volatility expansion during sustained selling pressure. The combination of price decline with rising volatility suggests distribution rather than healthy consolidation. Current regulatory uncertainty (FCA consultations) may amplify transition sensitivity.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes lower for 3 consecutive days
Volume on down days exceeds 30-day average by 15%

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price reclaims 3-day high or volatility drops below 60-day average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of signals fail to produce BEAR regime within 5 days OR false signals exceed 40% when backtested across 2023-2024 neutral periods.
